title: Why nobody builds Zz'Rot
body:
It's useless early game. Without the extra damage from built armor or MR, you aren't going to get a whole lot done with it. There are just better places to spend your gold for your first couple of items.

Mid game: tanks split pushing just doesn't work. You can't 1v1 anybody, and, for most tanks, don't have the mobility to escape when someone comes to counter you. Your time is better spent with the team then trying to slowly push down a tower. And you can't just drop a portal and leave because the voidspawns will almost never reach the tower

Late game: By this point, most of the towers should be down. Either your team is winning, in which case you don't have many options for where to splitpush and your team is going to want you for fights anyway. OR your team is losing, in which case you won't even get the chance to extend to a tower without dying in the process.

Also, the voidspawns just die. Like, they feel like they do nothing even when they rarely live. It just feels like a uselss item when they never get to the tower. I wish they ignored minions, or had more health, or didn't die after only 5 seconds on the field (mostly this one).

replies.body: I think it's major problem is that there are no splitpushing tanks.
{{champion:98}} ?
He only split pushes because he has a built in teleport, he actually really sucks at it and would be better served to build health than straight resists.
Shen's shield totally synergizes with resists. Yeah you could improve your Ki Strike damage a bit, but c'mon...

The only good thing about a Shen splitpushing is he has a teleport on his ult. Of course, by the time the ult finishes channeling in a teamfight, your carries will be dead and you have already lost the fight.

I have tried Shen with every wave clear item i could think of, {{item:3068}}, {{item:3074}}, {{item:3153}}, {{item:3078}}, and his wave clear always sucked. I suppose you could argue that {{item:3512}} is a wave clear item that works decent enough, but then you have to decide if you want to clear waves or if you want to take towers most of the time.

The thing is Void Spawns suck at taking out minions effectively. Say you're dropping a portal near your tower for defense as you stick with team for dragon etc. They just don't do enough, the last nerf on the item should be compensated with voidling AoE 200 radius 50% AP damage on minions they perform upon dying.

Or just stun the minions nearby when they die! A void sonic boom or something.

So if you want waveclear {{item:3068}}.

If you want to take down tower you're probably better with a {{item:3057}} item. 

Soo... yeah, the item should have a "stock" system where only 2 players on the team can buy it, so you can make it effective without having a whole team get it. (Most likely people to use it are top/jungle and maybe support.)

Although I disagree about Mundo, Zzrot is still a real shitty item
Everytime I use it, the enemy adc walks up and melts it.

I wish it was stealthed so the enemy would take a bit more effort to kill it, it dies too fast and AP -> dmg working on it doesn't help the issue.

It's easy to find because... follow the yellow brick road of spawns, and easy to kill. It's more effective against people who don't know how it works, sure.

But eventually everyone will know to ignore the spawns and kill the base ASAP. The base should be invis, the item is very expensive and most junglers should have {{item:3341}}, not to mention the base position is obvious due to spawns jumping out of it (would be great if that animation wasn't revealed for the enemy team, if this was to be implemented.)

I once saw an enemy Rengar kill my Zz'rot Portal in three hits.  That was quite possibly the most disappointed I've felt in this game in a long time.  

I had put it down about 20 seconds prior, expecting my team to siege the mid inhibitor tower.  We were 5v4 in our favor, after having just killed the enemy jungler.  Then our Jinx said "Brb getting BT." or something, and started recalling while at 95%hp.  The rest of us pinged and said to stay, but she didn't listen.  We didn't have enough damage to hold the siege until she returned, so we started backing off.  I could do nothing but watch as the Rengar tore through the thing I had just invested a lot of gold into.

IMO the main point of the item is lost on people when they see the big chunks being taken off of turrets and inhibs and they try to save the active for taking turrets.

As long as you put it in a position where it can maximize effectiveness vs. enemy creeps, i.e. behind the enemy creep line, your wave will push hard and you can go do splitpush/tfight in another lane. If you try to stay in the same lane as your portal you're just wasting your time. The portal is NOT meant to push fast like a hydra or shiv would. It's meant to grow pressure on another lane so you can draw an enemy team member away later and hopefully force a 4v5.
If you're not there to keep the enemy away from the Portal, there's still no point. We need some range/lifespan on the Voidspawn.
Did you know that on champs like Galio Leona and ramus or anyone who has a self armour/mr buff.  That is you use the buff then place the portal it will keep the extra damage?

Agreed. I also very much so dislike the fact that NOWHERE DOES IT SAY that the minions die over time of their own accord. They just like "Oh, I don't want to live anymore. Bye" before they even do anything... {{item:3512}}  See?

I built it once, placed it at base expecting the minions to be, well, minions, and get to lane. Nope. Died before they even did ANYTHING. It needs a buff, or change the item completely. The active is neat, but the stats aren't worth the investment.

Aren't you supposed to use it on-the-spot, instead of planting it in base and passively bulking up the minion wave?

The problem is that, if you place it on-the-spot, voidspawns will push a bit the lane and then... the lane is pushed enough so voidspawns will die trying to reach the minions. In fact, if you place it near your top turret, these voidspawns won't reach the enemy top turret.

yeah imagine top / jungle / and support rushing it ... and place 3 udner their top tower .. the enemy minions would never stand a chance to get to that tower and u can't just Dive it to kill 3 portals which are super tanky
It supposed to ASSIST you in pushing, not do your job for you. If it could push all the way from your tower to theirs, that is some considerable pushing strength.
I never said it should push the lane infinitely without help. I stated the fact that, if you are pushing, they will eventually die without reaching you.

But in that circumstance where you just place it under your tower and it goes to theirs, it would keep the lane infinitely pushed without help. Dealing with a portal an opponent placed under their tower would be too difficult. That's why it has a short range, so that it isn't used for safely pushing minions, but instead is mainly used for extra tower damage. I don't think it does that job well enough, but it does make sense as a goal.

It's an item that i think is better suited for split-pushing bruisers in place of their other armor/MR item(s). 

For example instead of building {{item:3156}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3153}} (probably not optimal anyway but i'm just illustrating a point)

you could build {{item:3512}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3071}}

which leaves you with double the lifesteal, a bit more MR, 1.5x the AD, and the armor pen, but less armor, health and AS.  If you want to survive and run away from your enemies you might go for the first set of items, but if you want to kill anyone who dares come for you you might go with the second set of items. Of course this is on top of the other split pushing items such as {{item:3068}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3074}} as random examples.

i build it on heimer every game

Its main problem is that GA offers same resistances with an amazing passive. So by making it slightly tankier this will be solved but still the passive is useless. Since its for top laners who are splitting I would love to see the current passive removed, put one on that makes the portal active be hidden and you can teleport to it in 1.5s and your tp cd is halved. This would be very strong on splitpushers but not overbearing or game breaking and it fits the theme better than the current passive.
It's a shame because Zz'Rot seems like one of these items that would make game more fun and diverse. When I saw it, I was excited but soon I discovered how useless it unfortunately is.

You don't build Zz'Rot portal to benefit from the extra damage given to every fourth Voidspawn, but to help an already pushing wave to push harder once you hit a turret.

I build Zz'Rot portal on Nasus and Udyr, and just by placing it just outside of turret range means I get a ton of extra damage off from it. Usually I'm able to take towers between 5-15 seconds faster just by using it (each Voidling spawns after the one before it comes a certain lenght away) so at best, two Voidspawn are out all the time, one reaching the turret and the other spawning. 

They are significant. They are never useless. I placed it right next to an inhib turret and the Voidspawns helped me win the game by pushing with me.

You can also use it to defend your base from one lane of super minions. I have found a few situational uses for zzrot, and I would consider building it if I needed a bit of MR on a tank that doesn't self-heal. Even dropping it in a lane and then going to seige another lane ensures that the lane with the portal will be pushed for the next little while and it might even get the tower eventually.
The main problem ZZ Top portal has is that Riot doesn't actually want anyone using it.

Though it does rely on you having a lane pushed near a turret to be effective.
